item.title: More Americans lost to COVID-19 than 1918 flu pandemic
item.description: Despite a century of medical advances, more Americans have now died from COVID-19 than the number who succumbed to the 1918 flu pandemic, according to new data.

item.title: AUV na airport taxi, bumaligtad sa highway sa Tagkawayan, Quezon; driver, sugatan
item.description: Sugatan ang driver ng isang AUV na airport taxi matapos itong bumaligtad at mahulog sa isang canal sa Quirino Highway, Barangay San Francisco, Tagkawayan, Quezon nitong Lunes ng gabi.

item.title: Biden speech at UN to stress US focus on 'intensive diplomacy,' official says
item.description: US President Joe Biden will use his speech at the United Nations on Tuesday to stress that ending the military engagement in Afghanistan will open a new chapter of "intensive diplomacy," a senior administration official said.

item.title: Vax van seeks to avert super-spreader event at UN summit
item.description: In a new take on vaccine diplomacy, a free mobile COVID-19 testing and vaccination station is welcoming world leaders and delegates at this week's UN General Assembly, seeking to avoid a super-spreader event.

item.title: Vietnam to buy 10 million Cuban COVID-19 vaccine doses
item.description: Cuba agreed Monday to provide Vietnam with 10 million doses of its home-grown coronavirus vaccine, Abdala, for which the Asian nation has given emergency approval.

item.title: Biden administration seeks to lift US refugee cap to 125,000
item.description: President Joe Biden's administration wants to nearly double the number of refugees admitted to the United States to 125,000 in the upcoming fiscal year starting on Oct. 1 in keeping with a campaign promise, according to a statement from the State Department.

item.title: Audience for Emmy Awards show rises to 7.4 million
item.description: The television audience for Sunday's Emmy Awards reached 7.4 million viewers, according to data released by broadcaster CBS, up some 16% from last year's record low.

item.title: Vaccine skeptic Bolsonaro gets a pass at UN but not New York restaurants
item.description: Unvaccinated heads of state attending the United Nation General Assembly this week may have to settle for a slice of pizza on a sidewalk instead of fine dining at New York's restaurants.

item.title: Two injured in shooting at US high school - police
item.description: Two 17-year-olds were injured in a shooting at a high school in the US state of Virginia on Monday, officials said, adding that the suspect had been arrested after fleeing the scene.

item.title: Still no ayuda given to those in granular lockdowns
item.description: More than 3,000 Filipino families are affected by granular lockdowns but financial aid coming from the national government has yet to be disbursed to them.

item.title: 'Giant' baby ng Butuan City, instant celebrity nang iuwi sa kanilang bahay
item.description: Instant celebrity sa kanilang lugar sa Butuan City ang "dambuhalang" sanggol na si Baby Mark na isinilang na may bigat na 11 pounds. Kumusta na nga ba siya at ang kaniyang ina?

item.title: American fugitive nabbed in Bohol town
item.description: An American national wanted for violation of his probation was arrested in Bohol on Monday afternoon, Sept. 20.

item.title: Philippines receives highest volume of vaccines in a week; majority made by Sinovac
item.description: In his presentation in the President's weekly Talk to the People, Galvez said the majority of vaccine doses delivered were manufactured by Sinovac, with fiveÂ million doses. This was followed by Pfizer with 2,774,070 doses; Moderna with 961,000; AstraZeneca with 661,200 and 190,000 Sputnik V second dose.

item.title: Batang naligaw noong 1989, makauwi na kaya sa kaniyang pamilya?
item.description: Ilang linggo matapos maitampok sa "Kapuso Mo, Jessica Soho" ang kuwento ni Alvin Bachli na nawala noong 1989, ilang pamilya ang nagpahayag na posibleng sila ang hinahanap nitong kaanak. Matapos na kaya ang paghahanap ni Alvin, na 38-anyos na ngayon.

item.title: In attack vs. Gordon, Duterte tells DOH to probe Red Cross false positives
item.description: President Rodrigo Duterte on Monday night asked the Department of Health to investigate the alleged "false positives" among the COVID-19 tests conducted by the Philippine Red Cross.
